footer.text: AEGIS — No data leaves your browser
home.title:
Your Insurance.
Client-Side Encrypted.
home.subtitle: AEGIS is a Dead Man's Switch — a system that protects your information and automatically releases it if you can no longer check in. Everything runs in your browser. No server. No accounts. No trust required.
home.feature.encryption.title: AES-256 Encryption
home.feature.encryption.desc: Military-grade encryption directly in your browser. Your data never leaves your device unencrypted.
home.feature.shamir.title: Shamir's Secret Sharing
home.feature.shamir.desc: The key is split into fragments. Only together can your trusted guardians decrypt.
home.feature.deadman.title: Dead Man's Switch
home.feature.deadman.desc: Regular check-ins keep the system dormant. If they stop, escalation begins automatically.
home.feature.duress.title: Duress Code
home.feature.duress.desc: A special code secretly signals your guardians that you are acting under coercion.
home.howitworks.title: How does AEGIS work?
home.howitworks.step1: 1. Setup: Upload your evidence, choose a passphrase and a duress passphrase. Everything is encrypted in your browser.
home.howitworks.step2: 2. Distribute: The decryption key is split into fragments. Each guardian receives a kit with their fragment and instructions.
home.howitworks.step3: 3. Check-in: Check in regularly with your passphrase. Your guardians receive a token proving everything is fine.
home.howitworks.step4: 4. Protection: Being coerced? Use the duress code — the token looks normal, but your guardians detect the hidden signal.
home.howitworks.step5: 5. Escalation: If check-ins stop, your guardians know what to do. Their fragments together reveal the key.
home.alert.clientside: 100% client-side. This app runs entirely in your browser. There is no server, no database, no accounts. You can use it offline — just download the files. The source code is openly available.

verify.explain.title: What is Proof of Existence?
verify.explain.text: A Proof of Existence proves that certain data existed at a specific point in time — without revealing the content. A cryptographic hash (SHA-256) of the data is calculated and posted publicly (e.g. on Twitter, a blog, or the Bitcoin blockchain via OpenTimestamps). Any change, no matter how small, to the original data produces a completely different hash. This allows anyone to verify that the data has not been altered since the posting.
howitworks.title: How It Works
howitworks.subtitle: Understanding AEGIS — a client-side Dead Man's Switch.
howitworks.what.title: What is a Dead Man's Switch?
howitworks.what.text: A Dead Man's Switch is a mechanism that activates automatically when a person fails to perform a regular action. Originally used in trains and industrial equipment, the concept has been adapted for digital security: if you stop checking in regularly, pre-configured actions are triggered — in this case, the release of encrypted evidence to your trusted guardians.
howitworks.system.title: The AEGIS System
howitworks.system.step1.title: 1. Setup
howitworks.system.step1.text: You upload your evidence files and choose a strong passphrase. All encryption happens locally in your browser using AES-256-GCM. You also set a duress passphrase — a secondary code for emergencies.
howitworks.system.step2.title: 2. Distribute
howitworks.system.step2.text: The passphrase is split into fragments using Shamir's Secret Sharing. Each guardian receives a kit containing their unique fragment and detailed instructions. No single guardian can decrypt alone.
howitworks.system.step3.title: 3. Check-in
howitworks.system.step3.text: You check in regularly by entering your passphrase. This generates a cryptographic token that you send to your guardians, proving you are safe and active.
howitworks.system.step4.title: 4. Duress Protection
howitworks.system.step4.text: If you are under coercion, entering the duress passphrase generates a token that appears identical but contains a hidden flag. Your guardians can detect this and know to escalate immediately.
howitworks.system.step5.title: 5. Escalation
howitworks.system.step5.text: If check-ins stop, guardians follow a pre-defined escalation plan. They combine their fragments to reconstruct the passphrase and decrypt the evidence package.
howitworks.guardian.title: The Guardian Concept
howitworks.guardian.text: Guardians are trusted persons who each hold one fragment of the decryption key. They have three responsibilities: (1) regularly verify your check-in tokens, (2) detect duress signals, and (3) coordinate with other guardians during escalation. A configurable threshold ensures that a minimum number of guardians must cooperate — protecting against both single-point failures and betrayal.
howitworks.encryption.title: Client-Side Encryption
howitworks.encryption.text: AEGIS uses the Web Crypto API built into modern browsers. All encryption (AES-256-GCM) and key derivation (PBKDF2 with 600,000 iterations) happen locally. No plaintext data ever leaves your device. The encrypted package can be stored anywhere — cloud, USB, IPFS — without compromising security.
howitworks.authority.title: No Central Authority
howitworks.authority.text: AEGIS has no server, no database, no accounts, and no central point of failure. The system is fully distributed: you hold the encrypted data, your guardians hold the key fragments, and the check-in verification is purely cryptographic. No one — not even the developers — can access your data.
howitworks.warning.title: Security Notice
howitworks.warning.text: AEGIS is a tool, not a guarantee. Your security depends on: the strength of your passphrase, the trustworthiness of your guardians, the safe storage of the encrypted package, and regular check-ins. Losing your passphrase means losing access. If all guardian fragments are compromised, your data is exposed. Use AEGIS as one layer in a comprehensive security strategy.
